alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 06 at 9:50AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLASH FLOODING POSSIBLE BY MONDAY... A monsoonal trough to the southwest of American Samoa is forecast to move northeastward towards the islands beginning Monday. This feature will increase the potential for heavy rainfall and flash flooding over American Samoa starting during the day Monday. The threat of flash flooding is expected to continue through Monday night and Tuesday and possibly into Tuesday night. A high pressure system is then forecast to push the trough away to the southwest and end the flash flooding threat by Wednesday. Please keep up to date with the latest forecast information through our website (weather.gov/ppg), local media, social media, or NOAA Weather Radio broadcats. An updated outlook will be issued by 10 PM SST Sunday, or sooner if necessary.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
